title: Conservation laws - compare pressure at two points

content.question: A cylindrical water reservoir connected to a hose is used to fill a small cup, as shown in the figure. The diameter of the reservoir is <math alttext="uppercase D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> and the diameter of the hose is <math alttext="lowercase d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, where <math alttext="uppercase D is greater than lowercase d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi><mo>></mo><mi>d</mi></math>. Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, inside the reservoir, and Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, inside the hose, are at the same height. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the pressure at Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, to <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, the pressure at Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub 1 is greater than P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
